page.description: Returns the word number of the word in which substring was found.
page.syntax: Position as N = word_number_get(C string ,C substring ,C delimiter [,L match_full_words_only [,L caseSensitive ]])

argument.name: substring
argument.description: The character string to find. Case sensitive.

argument.name: delimiter
argument.description: Default = CR-LF. The separator between character strings. Note that the space (" ") character may not be used as a delimiter.

argument.name: match_full_words_only
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .F.
.T. = Match full words only
.F. = Match character strings or full words

argument.name: caseSensitive
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .F.
.T. = Match only words with same case
.F. = Ignore case

page.discussion: WORD_NUMBER_GET() returns the integer list position of the Find_String in the Search_In_String. Each character string must be separated by a delimiter, which by default is CR-LF. The function returns 0 if Find_String was not found.
page.example: ? word_number_get(cstates() , "Maryland", crlf() ) = 21 ? word_number_get(cstates() , "Mary", crlf() , .T.) = 0 ? word_number_get(cstates() , "Mary", crlf() ) = 21 ? word_number_get(cstates() , "land", crlf() ) = 21 ? word_number_get(cstates() , "Max", crlf() ) = 0
